snippet.title: Amazon Kindle Fire HDX 7
snippet.description: Armed with a powerful processor and Amazon's exhaustive content library, the Kindle Fire HDX delivers incredible value for its price, especially for Amazon Prime members.

snippet.title: Amazon Fire TV
snippet.description: The Fire TV streaming-media box is an impressive living room debut for Amazon, with standout features like voice search, gaming, and superfast video streaming, but it falls short of being an elite streamer -- at least for now.

snippet.title: Fire Game Controller
snippet.description: Get ready for living-room gaming, Amazon-style: a new controller aims to bring games to the big screen with Fire TV.

snippet.title: Alcatel Onetouch Fire E
snippet.description: The new Fire E by Alcatel wraps up Firefox software into a very slim package for 139 euros.

snippet.title: Alcatel One Touch Fire S
snippet.description: The 4.5-inch smartphone will retail for 169 euros ($232) and will make its debut in the Q3.

snippet.title: Alcatel One Touch Fire 7
snippet.description: Priced at 79 euros and due in Q3, could the first Firefox OS-based slate be a game changer?

snippet.title: Alcatel One Touch Fire C
snippet.description: At 59 euro, the Alcatel Fire C is the company's lowest-priced Firefix OS handset yet.

snippet.title: Amazon Kindle Fire (2012)
snippet.description: The Kindle Fire (2012) takes it up a notch in value, but is tethered to the same design oversights of the original.

snippet.title: Amazon Kindle Fire
snippet.description: Though it lacks the tech specs found on more-expensive Apple and Android tablets, the $199 Kindle Fire is an outstanding entertainment value that prizes simplicity over techno-wizardry.

snippet.title: Amazon Kindle Fire HD (2013)
snippet.description: The 2013 Kindle Fire HD works perfectly as an e-reader with a few extra tablet features, but users looking to take full advantage of Amazon's ecosystem should pay more for the Fire HDX.
